update.description:
To solve Issue#1665
The resulting behaviour is that Ctrl+S (or File->Save) will open the SaveAs Dialogue box if the file hasn't been saved before.

P.S. New at this. So please provide me suggestions and corrections on code style. Thank you.
update.title: Ctrl+S now opens SaveAs dialog for freshly saving file

content.raw:
Actually yes @chapulina ! The method of triggering the menu is varied here. Instead of Ctrl+Shift+S or simply clicking the option in the menu one uses Ctrl+S to trigger SaveAs. How does one incorporate the method of a trigger in the test? 

EDIT:  Actually I think I got this. But as I have modified the Save function in this PR, wouldn't it be better to just modify the Save Test than to create another one for this?

content.raw:
This works for me! I just have one comment about a cppcheck error.

Also, it would be interesting to write a test for this if you're interested, but it's not required. The test would go into `MainWindow_TEST`, trigger save / save as, fill the browse dialog as needed, verify that the file was created, then delete the file. There is a similar example [here](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/35a658f8d8d5c789196730975db04b45633276f0/src/MainWindow_TEST.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#MainWindow_TEST.cc-98); it's not exactly the same because save and save as have slightly different meanings there, but the way the action is triggered and the file is saved should be the same.
content.html:
This works for me! I just have one comment about a cppcheck error.

Also, it would be interesting to write a test for this if you're interested, but it's not required. The test would go into MainWindow_TEST, trigger save / save as, fill the browse dialog as needed, verify that the file was created, then delete the file. There is a similar example here; it's not exactly the same because save and save as have slightly different meanings there, but the way the action is triggered and the file is saved should be the same.

content.raw:
When I run:

`sh tools/code_check.sh`

I get one error on this line:

`./gazebo/gui/MainWindow.cc:511:  Missing spaces around =  [whitespace/operators] [4]`

Another suggestion is to explicitly use the word `true` instead of `1` and on `MainWindowPrivate` use `false` instead of `0`
content.html:
When I run:

sh tools/code_check.sh

I get one error on this line:

./gazebo/gui/MainWindow.cc:511: Missing spaces around = [whitespace/operators] [4]

Another suggestion is to explicitly use the word true instead of 1 and on MainWindowPrivate use false instead of 0

content.raw:
I don't see this ever being set to true below, should it be?

We try to avoid global variables as much as possible, what do you think of making this into a private member variable of `MainWindow`? Since this class uses the PIMPL pattern, the variable should go in `MainWindowPrivate.hh`.
content.html:
I don't see this ever being set to true below, should it be?

We try to avoid global variables as much as possible, what do you think of making this into a private member variable of MainWindow? Since this class uses the PIMPL pattern, the variable should go in MainWindowPrivate.hh.
